Clownfish

Amphiprioninae

Also known as: Anemonefish

reef‐safe marine community

Overview

A small, vividly colored marine fish that is known for its symbiotic relationship with sea anemones. Clownfish are protected from the stinging tentacles of anemones due to a layer of mucus they develop that provides immunity. They are popular in marine aquariums due to their bright colors and interesting behavior.

Taxonomy

Kingdom:
Animalia
Phylum:
Chordata
Class:
Actinopterygii
Order:
Perciformes
Family:
Pomacentridae
Genus:
Amphiprion

Distribution

Natural range: Red Sea, Western Pacific

Size

Average:
8 cm
Maximum:
10 cm

Lifespan

Typical:
6 years
Maximum:
10 years

Care Level

Moderate

Sexual Dimorphism

Females larger and more colorful

Habitat

Type: Coral reef, Lagoon

Depth: 1 - 15 m

Substrate: Live rock, Anemone hosts

Water Parameters

Temperature

24 - 27 °C

pH

7.8 - 8.4

Hardness

8 - 12 dGH

Salinity

1.02 - 1.026 sg

Ammonia

Max: 0 ppm

Nitrite

Max: 0 ppm

Nitrate

Max: 20 ppm

Tank Requirements

Minimum Volume:
75 L
Recommended Volume:
100 L
Tank Shape:
Standard rectangle
Water Flow:
Moderate
Filtration:
Protein skimmer + biological filter
Lighting:
Full‐spectrum LED (8 - 10 hours/day)
Aquascape:
Live rock, Caves, Host anemone

Diet

Type: Omnivore

Staple foods: Flake food, Pellets

Supplements: Frozen mysis shrimp, Brine shrimp, Algae wafers

Feeding frequency: 2 times per day

Small portions to avoid overfeeding.

Behavior

Temperament:
Peaceful except among conspecifics
Social:
Pairs or small groups; hierarchical
Territorial:
Mildly

Compatibility

Suitable tankmates: Gobies, Blennies, Tangs

Avoid: Large aggressive species, Anemone predators

Breeding

Type:
Egg layer
Spawning Behavior:
Forms monogamous pairs; lays eggs on flat surfaces
Difficulty:
Moderate
Egg Care:
Adults guard the nest; remove fry to rearing tank
Notes:
Require anemone hosts for natural pairing.

Health

Common diseases: Brooklynella, Marine ich

Treatments: Freshwater dips, Medication per vet guidance

Price & Availability

Price range: 15 - 30 USD

Availability: Common

Conservation Status

IUCN:
Least Concern
CITES:
Appendix II

References
